sn12.64:2.1: Consciousness is organic, established or planted like a seed, for which see also SN 22.54, AN 3.76], [AN 3.77.
sn12.64:2.3: As an individual matures, they develop the capacity to make responsible moral decisions.
sn12.64:2.4: Here choices in this life directly beget rebirth, which is normally stated as “consciousness”.
sn12.64:8.8: If a beam of light does not land anywhere, it cannot perform its key function, namely to illuminate. Likewise, if consciousness is not established in craving, it cannot perform its key function of perpetuating the cycle of rebirth.
